Ingredients: 

• 1 cup all-purpose flour 
• 2 large eggs 
• 1 1/2 cups milk 
• 2 tablespoons melted butter 
• 1/4 teaspoon salt 
• 1 tablespoon granulated sugar (for sweet crepes, optional) 
• Additional melted butter for cooking 
• Your choice of fillings (e.g., Nutella, fresh fruit, whipped cream, cheese, ham, etc.) 

Procedure: 

1. Prepare the Batter: 

 In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, eggs, milk, melted butter, salt, and sugar (if making sweet crepes). Mix until you have a smooth, thin batter. You can also use a blender for this step. 
 Let the batter rest for about 30 minutes at room temperature. This allows the flour to fully absorb the liquid and results in a smoother batter. 

2. Cook the Crepes: 
\* Heat a non-stick skillet or crepe pan over medium-high heat. You can add a little melted butter to coat the pan, but this is optional if your pan is truly non-stick. 
* Pour a small amount of batter into the center of the hot pan, swirling it around quickly to spread it thinly across the bottom. The goal is to create a very thin layer of batter. 
* Cook for about 1-2 minutes or until the edges of the crepe start to lift from the pan and the bottom is lightly golden. Use a spatula to flip the crepe and cook the other side for an additional 1-2 minutes, or until golden. 
* Remove the cooked crepe from the pan and set it aside on a plate. Repeat the process with the remaining batter, adding a little more butter to the pan as needed to prevent sticking. 

3. Serve the Crepes: 

* Once all the crepes are cooked, fill them with your choice of sweet or savory fillings. 
* For sweet crepes, you can fill them with Nutella, fresh fruit, jam, whipped cream, or a sprinkle of powdered sugar. 
* For savory crepes, consider fillings like cheese, ham, spinach, mushrooms, or smoked salmon. 

4. Fold the crepes into quarters or roll them up, and they're ready to serve. 


Crepes are highly customizable, and you can get creative with your fillings. Enjoy your homemade crepes with your favorite ingredients!
